executive_summary: Companies in heavy equipment rental lease heavy construction and transportation equipment, ranging from excavators to airplanes. The industry's financial performance is subject to trends and activity in an array of downstream markets, including air, sea and rail transportation; highway, street and bridge construction; and oil exploration and drilling. In the years to 2023, activity in downstream markets, particularly air and rail transportation, has supported revenue, but a downturn in 2020 disrupted this growth. The COVID-19 outbreak caused a contraction in revenue, driven by a decline in industrial activity. Activity largely resumed in 2021, but slowed significantly in 2023. Revenue fell overall at a CAGR of 0.6% through the end of 2023 to $47.6 billion, including a decline of 3.5% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue Volatility Increased as a Result of COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of COVID-19 interfered with regular activity in a range of downstream markets, including forestry, mining, residential, nonresidential and infrastructure construction. As the level of industrial activity declined, private investment in industrial equipment receded.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rail Transportation Increases in Tandem With an Increase in Coal Production
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Trains are used to transport consumer goods, commodities and industrial materials, like various metals, chemicals, gas, oil and coal. Production of these goods grows revenue, as does transporting them by rail and increasing the number of leased locomotives and railcars.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Aircraft Transportation Decreased Because of COVID-19 Restrictions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Major airlines lease aircraft to maintain flexibility and minimize purchase costs. COVID-19 prevented most travel in 2020, and airlines struggled to operate at near 20.0% capacity. Following successful vaccination efforts, air transportation recovered extremely well.

Large construction projects have resumed after COVID-19. Economic stimulus and incentives have resulted in a boom in commercial construction and, therefore equipment rental. However, residential construction has slowed as the looming recession threatens per-capita disposable income.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Increased Industrial Activity is Driving Private Investment in Industrial Equipment
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Most industrial activity that requires the use of heavy-duty equipment rental has been limited by economic strain during the pandemic. The rollout of state and federal infrastructure projects will significantly increase the need for heavy equipment rental moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SHIFTING GOVERNMENT POLICIES WILL INFLUENCE INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While federal and state infrastructure plans are currently underway, many are expected to take significant time to unfold, delaying any potential revenue growth to later in the period. The Biden administration's climate goals of halving carbon emissions by 2030 by focusing on renewable energy and applying a price on carbon would increase costs for heavy equipment lessors.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPANIES WILL CONTINUE CONSOLIDATION ATTEMPTS TO DEAL WITH RISING COSTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Ongoing consolidation and efficiency improvements will limit robust employment growth. Major players will continue their acquisition activity moving forward; at the same time, new companies will join the industry despite high barriers to entry, namely extremely high capital outlays.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Construction Activity Will Rise as Aging US Infrastructure Requires Maintenance
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising inflation and the exorbitantly high cost of living will continue to limit demand for heavy equipment for residential construction. Rapidly deteriorating infrastructure in the US will fuel a need for heavy construction equipment.

industry_definition: Industry operators rent or lease heavy construction, off-highway transportation, mining and forestry machinery and equipment without attached labor. Operators in this industry may rent or lease products including aircrafts, railcars, steamships, tugboats, bulldozers, earthmoving equipment, cranes or well-drilling machinery and equipment.
key_trends: Industry performance largely depends on the activities of downstream markets. These primarily include transportation and logistics, construction, coal mining, oil drilling and gas extraction.
Concerns about climate change will affect activity in the outlook period. The current administration will focus on reducing carbon emissions, impacting activity in downstream markets.
When companies lease instead of purchase they receive tax cuts, which increases business for lessors.
In dealing with hazardous materials, proper storage and disposal are essential.
Air transportation equipment leases are sensitive to fluctuations in passenger and cargo traffic, affected by travel restrictions and supply chain disruptions especially due to COVID-19.
Construction, industrial, mining and forestry operations experience volatility and seasonality in their ventures. This makes leasing equipment, as opposed to buying it, cost-effective.
Rental equipment companies are distributed according to infrastructure requirements in the US. Equipment must be located near projects for accessibility.

The largest financial leasing companies in heavy equipment rental are located in major financial centers like New York and Chicago. These company headquarters direct operations throughout the nation through a network of branches and associates.
There are four companies responsible for the majority of industry revenue. The rest of the market is fragmented and made up of much smaller companies.
Consolidation activity has been increasing between small and larger operators. This way smaller companies can benefit from economies of scale and larger companies can broaden their reach.

market_segmentation.segment: Construction, industrial, mining and forestry operations
market_segmentation.segment_description: Users in this industry use equipment to build new housing or commercial structures, clear land and move earth for mining or logging operations. Clients in this segment can range from large construction companies and oil and gas companies to small contractors.

These operations involve the transport of individuals and goods by air, rail or water. Airlines use leased aircraft to retain flexibility in renewing fleets and because they might not have the financial resources to outright purchase aircraft. As overall economic conditions recovered in 2021 and 2022, domestic and international travel has risen. Increased travel by individuals and investment in new airplanes has driven activity in this market. Coal and petrochemical manufacturers also help drive demand for rail and water transportation equipment lessees.

tier_1_suppliers: Structural Metal Product Manufacturing in the US
Wire & Spring Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Tractors & Agricultural Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Construction Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Mining, Oil & Gas Machinery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Air Transportation Equipment Leases Are Sensitive to Fluctuations in Passenger and Cargo Traffic
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Air travel refers to the transport of people and property by passenger aircraft and its performance is dependent on general business activity and economic conditions.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for Rail Transportation Equipment Fluctuated During the Period
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Rail transportation equipment is used to transfer goods and passengers in railcars or locomotives.

business_locations.location: Many Buying Markets Are Concentrated in the Southeast
business_locations.location_description: The heavy equipment rental market is concentrated in this region, with an estimated 25.0% of industry establishments.

business_locations.location: THE SOUTHWEST IS THE SECOND-LARGEST IN TERMS OF CONSTRUCTION ESTABLISHMENTS
business_locations.location_description: Texas is a key location for many large rolling-stock manufacturers, which tend to operate leasing businesses using their inventories.

business_locations.location: THE WEST IS PRIMARILY HOME TO LOGGING AND MINING ACTIVITY
business_locations.location_description: The high volume of goods produced in California (from produce to logging) creates a need for reliable transportation leases.

regulations_points.regulation_description: There are federal and state laws that regulate the treatment and storage of solid waste and hazardous materials.
These regulations require equipment to be continually monitored, modified and adjusted to comply with standards for its operation.
Lessors of aircraft, vessels, locomotives and railcars are subject to regulations set by the US Department of Transportation.
In February 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) implemented new standards on accounting for leases.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The heavy equipment rental industry is fragmented.
concentration_points.concentration_description: The heavy equipment rental industry is fragmented.

concentration_points.concentration_title: The four largest companies account for the majority of the industry's revenue in 2023.
concentration_points.concentration_description: The four largest companies account for the majority of the industry's revenue in 2023.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Depreciation is expected to account for an estimated 15.7% of industry revenue in 2023.
Purchase costs include oil, lubricants and replacement parts used for heavy equipment.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage costs have declined in recent years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, wages account for 14.6% of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Equipment leasing companies need considerable backing
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Equipment leasing companies need considerable backing from investors to finance high-cost items.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent technologies
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in the value of construction
volatility_points.volatility_description: The cyclical nature causes volatility in demand from the energy sector.
Long-term contracts tend to balance revenue changes.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Company Has Implemented the Use of State-of-the-Art Technologies
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The company constantly seeks ways to enhance, redesign and upgrade technology.

FAQs.question: Do your company's sales rely on the overall health of the US economy at large?
FAQs.answer: Demand for industry products tends to move in line with general construction activity.

FAQs.question: Does your company lease a variety of industry products or specialize in one vertical?
FAQs.answer: Specialized lessors may have a reputation in the space, boosting sales.
